{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3451947,"name":"","username":"MidnightSlate","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/e19adc/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-11-26T10:49:11.676Z","cooked":"

I’m developing a custom CAN bus encoder and am starting to test it with the Roborio. Right now, I have it sending a CAN frame every ~10 ms and am using readPacketLatest​() to get the data.

My question is about the best strategy for sending data on the CAN bus. Should the encoder autonomously broadcast its angle data at a regular interval, or should it wait for the RoboRIO to request the data when needed? Is there a standardized way of doing this?

Currently, I’m sending the 21-bit angle value packed into 3 bytes and sending it every ~10 ms. Is this reasonable from both a bus utilization and and good responsiveness perspective? If my math is correct, that is 8.3 kb/s. Is that high or low?

Let me know what you all think.

For those curious, here is a picture of the encoder. It is still WIP. The smaller board connects to the larder board.

IMG_54901920×1440 405 KB

This is my work-in-progress 21-bit absolute encoder, which includes additional IO for features like limit switches or LIDAR sensors. Its two-board system is designed for flexibility, with configurations ranging from a large board with Molex SL connectors to a smaller solder-only version, or an expanded board with I2C/SPI capabilities.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-11-26T10:49:11.676Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":19,"reads":335,"readers_count":334,"score":222.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":475614,"topic_slug":"custom-can-devices-should-my-device-initiate-or-respond-on-the-can-bus","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69307,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"vertosrobotics.com"},"post_url":"/t/custom-can-devices-should-my-device-initiate-or-respond-on-the-can-bus/475614/1","custom_user_title":"vertosrobotics.com","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3451948,"name":"Jim Sokoloff","username":"sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png","created_at":"2024-11-26T11:22:05.018Z","cooked":"

I would think that having your controller broadcast frames periodically is fine/normal. However, you probably want to define a message to your controller to adjust that frequency, rather than hard-coding it at 100Hz. Similarly, you could have messages to start/stop or otherwise configure the device. You won’t know what other people want to do with it.

For bus utilization, I get a slightly smaller figure than yours, unless you’re reserving an extra byte of payload for additional sensor/contact closure transmission, but it’s still in the same ballpark and would be a little under 1% of total CAN bandwidth on a 1 Mbps CAN 2.0 bus.

(As an additional reference, the typical RoboRio control loop is 50Hz, so at least half of your messages would not be seen in a typical robot control configuration.)

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-11-26T11:22:05.018Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":313,"readers_count":312,"score":127.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":475614,"topic_slug":"custom-can-devices-should-my-device-initiate-or-respond-on-the-can-bus","display_username":"Jim Sokoloff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66298,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"97 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/custom-can-devices-should-my-device-initiate-or-respond-on-the-can-bus/475614/2","custom_user_title":"97 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3452173,"name":"","username":"MidnightSlate","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/e19adc/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-11-26T23:47:18.217Z","cooked":"

Good points!

Having configuration settings that could easily be changed would be the best. For a CAN bus, should the peak utilization be kept under a certain percentage or can it go all the way up to 100%?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-11-26T23:47:18.217Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":251,"readers_count":250,"score":55.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":475614,"topic_slug":"custom-can-devices-should-my-device-initiate-or-respond-on-the-can-bus","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69307,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"vertosrobotics.com"},"post_url":"/t/custom-can-devices-should-my-device-initiate-or-respond-on-the-can-bus/475614/3","custom_user_title":"vertosrobotics.com","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3452196,"name":"Jim Sokoloff","username":"sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png","created_at":"2024-11-27T01:02:26.092Z","cooked":"

I think 80% is a good upper limit.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-11-27T01:02:26.092Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":224,"readers_count":223,"score":59.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":475614,"topic_slug":"custom-can-devices-should-my-device-initiate-or-respond-on-the-can-bus","display_username":"Jim Sokoloff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":69307,"username":"MidnightSlate","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/e19adc/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66298,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"97 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/custom-can-devices-should-my-device-initiate-or-respond-on-the-can-bus/475614/4","custom_user_title":"97 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3452787,"name":"","username":"MidnightSlate","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/e19adc/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-11-28T02:02:17.544Z","cooked":"

One more question, do you think it would make sense to try to synchonize the outgoing sensor data with the Robot periodic() function so the data is always ‘fresh’? Could having data that is up to 19 ms old be noticeable or is it negligible in typical FRC?

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-11-28T02:02:17.544Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":183,"readers_count":182,"score":41.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":475614,"topic_slug":"custom-can-devices-should-my-device-initiate-or-respond-on-the-can-bus","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":66298,"username":"sokoloff","name":"Jim Sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69307,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"vertosrobotics.com"},"post_url":"/t/custom-can-devices-should-my-device-initiate-or-respond-on-the-can-bus/475614/5","custom_user_title":"vertosrobotics.com","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3452788,"name":"Jim Sokoloff","username":"sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png","created_at":"2024-11-28T02:19:41.979Z","cooked":"

I think to address that, I’d perhaps reset the internal timer on your device upon a new command to set the frequency of reports.

That way, a team that wanted to try doing that could do it (by issuing a carefully timed frequency update), but in general, I don’t think it’s going to make or break the typical application. (If it mattered that much for a given application, a team could ask for 200Hz updates and/or run their own robot code at a higher frequency, so giving teams the control is the way I think.)

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-11-28T02:19:41.979Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":169,"readers_count":168,"score":48.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":475614,"topic_slug":"custom-can-devices-should-my-device-initiate-or-respond-on-the-can-bus","display_username":"Jim Sokoloff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":69307,"username":"MidnightSlate","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/e19adc/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66298,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"97 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/custom-can-devices-should-my-device-initiate-or-respond-on-the-can-bus/475614/6","custom_user_title":"97 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3452799,"name":"joel truher","username":"truher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/truher/{size}/172222_2.png","created_at":"2024-11-28T03:31:28.003Z","cooked":"

re: synchronization, it’s always nice to give your client the data it needs to make a good guess about the current state. the CANData struct includes a timestamp, which I think is referenced to CAN.GetTimestampBaseTime(), so you could provide an “age” of the measurement in milliseconds.

it’s also nice to provide both the measurement and its derivative, so that the client could do a first-order approximation for the current instant. as i understand it, this is what CTRE do for their “latency compensation” feature. the reason to provide the derivative in the CAN payload is that, presumably, your higher sample rate means you can calculate it more accurately than the RoboRIO possibly could. if the client has a low-noise derivative handy, then they could do full-state control with it, which is also nice.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-11-28T03:31:28.003Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":151,"readers_count":150,"score":65.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":475614,"topic_slug":"custom-can-devices-should-my-device-initiate-or-respond-on-the-can-bus","display_username":"joel truher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53190,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/custom-can-devices-should-my-device-initiate-or-respond-on-the-can-bus/475614/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3452814,"name":"Chadfrom7226","username":"Chadfrom7226","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chadfrom7226/{size}/113429_2.png","created_at":"2024-11-28T04:30:23.576Z","cooked":"

Excited to see your encoder. Is this open source or are you going to sell it?

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-11-28T04:30:23.576Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":141,"readers_count":140,"score":33.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":475614,"topic_slug":"custom-can-devices-should-my-device-initiate-or-respond-on-the-can-bus","display_username":"Chadfrom7226","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20021,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/custom-can-devices-should-my-device-initiate-or-respond-on-the-can-bus/475614/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3453273,"name":"","username":"MidnightSlate","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/e19adc/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-11-30T09:23:33.657Z","cooked":"

Excellent suggestions! i didn’t even think to use GetTimestampBaseTime(). Seems like there is also a lot of benefit to having take datapoints at higher than 50 Hz and then doing some processing to clean up noise and calculate the derivative.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-11-30T09:23:33.657Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":119,"readers_count":118,"score":23.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":475614,"topic_slug":"custom-can-devices-should-my-device-initiate-or-respond-on-the-can-bus","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":53190,"username":"truher","name":"joel truher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/truher/{size}/172222_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69307,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"vertosrobotics.com"},"post_url":"/t/custom-can-devices-should-my-device-initiate-or-respond-on-the-can-bus/475614/9","custom_user_title":"vertosrobotics.com","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3453274,"name":"","username":"MidnightSlate","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/e19adc/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-11-30T09:46:46.107Z","cooked":"

Thank you!

I initially planned to keep this project within my team and not sell it until I could perform more rigorous testing. However, as I was writing this, I realized it might need to be sold or open-sourced to comply with the rules. If I remember correctly, it can’t remain closed-source if it’s to be used in a 2025 robot. I’ll have to gauge the interest in this project and decide on the next steps accordingly.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-11-30T09:46:46.107Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":118,"readers_count":117,"score":28.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":475614,"topic_slug":"custom-can-devices-should-my-device-initiate-or-respond-on-the-can-bus","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":20021,"username":"Chadfrom7226","name":"Chadfrom7226","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chadfrom7226/{size}/113429_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69307,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"vertosrobotics.com"},"post_url":"/t/custom-can-devices-should-my-device-initiate-or-respond-on-the-can-bus/475614/10","custom_user_title":"vertosrobotics.com","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3453430,"name":"Justin Nesselrotte","username":"jnesselr","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jnesselr/{size}/199903_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-01T05:15:17.073Z","cooked":"

This looks great! Did you assemble this by hand?

I’d love to keep up with whatever you post on this subject so keep the updates coming! I haven’t thought of any CAN devices I’d want to build to help out in the FRC world but I’ve worked with CAN before and you sound like you’ve got a pretty good start on this.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-12-01T05:15:17.073Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":98,"readers_count":97,"score":54.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":475614,"topic_slug":"custom-can-devices-should-my-device-initiate-or-respond-on-the-can-bus","display_username":"Justin Nesselrotte","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60515,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"9586 Lead Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/custom-can-devices-should-my-device-initiate-or-respond-on-the-can-bus/475614/11","custom_user_title":"9586 Lead Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3456370,"name":"","username":"MidnightSlate","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/e19adc/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-12-08T02:41:56.667Z","cooked":"

Thank you! I had the boards printed and assembled by JLCPCB. It only took 2 weeks because I selected parts from their in-stock options for turnkey prototyping. My only thorn is that there was an additional $50 setup fee for double sided PCBA.

I am currently testing this on a robot and I will probably do a build showcase soon in another post. So far, everything is looking promising!
